body_content.explanation: a fungus (= an organism that get its food from decaying material or other living things) that grows on the fruits and flowers of plants:
examples: The most common form of botrytis is grey mould, which can affect many plants and fruits.
Botrytis is of particular concern to winemakers, who need to protect their vines from this damaging fungus, although there is also "good" botrytis which can help to make sweet wines.
